ShadowQuest

Class Monster

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShadowQuest.GameObject
      • ShadowQuest.Unit
        • ShadowQuest.Monster
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggressiveMonster, PassiveMonster

    public abstract class Monster
extends Unit
    Class providing methods to enable monster interaction. Monsters are split into two types: Aggressive Monsters and Passive Monsters, which have different behaviour. All monsters can move, have stats, and can be attacked and killed by the player.
    Author:
    Adrian Cheung

      • Fields inherited from class ShadowQuest.Unit

    • Constructor Detail

      • Monster

        public Monster(Position pos,
               Stats stats,
               java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String ref)
        throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Creates a monster object
        Parameters:
        pos: - Position on the map the monster spawns at
        stats: - Monster base stats, refer to Stats class for more information
        name: - The monster 'type', e.g. Zombie, Skeleton, Bandit etc.
        ref: - Location of the image used when rendering the monster
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - General exception type thrown by Slick library classes

    • Method Detail

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(double dmg)
        Parameters:
        dmg: - Amount to reduce monster's health by

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Position target,
                   World world,
                   boolean approach,
                   int delta)
        Given a set distance to move per update(speed), the monster will move towards or away from a target location
        Parameters:
        target: - The target location to move towards, or away from
        world: - The world in which the movement takes place
        approach: - If this is true, move towards the target, else, move away
        delta: - Number of milliseconds between updates

      • renderMonster

        public void renderMonster(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics g,
                          Camera camera)
                   throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
        Render the monster relative to the camera position. Render both the monster itself as well as the label showing monster's type and current health.
        Parameters:
        g: - The Slick graphics object, used for drawing
        camera: - Camera used to display the world
        Throws:
        org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - General exception thrown by Slick library classes
